div1.p: Hurrah! hurrah! It's a beautiful book, inside and out, and I have been rejoicing over it a whole forenoon. The contents, of course, are familiar, but it is thrilling to hold the book in my hands!

Slade, dear younger brother, you surely
-2-
did a good job, and there will be many who will thank you for the help you will have given them.

The book is practical. It is certain to help a sincere troubled person to realize his problem and work on it in a reasonable way. I am unable to solve for myself all the problems you analyze, but I know your suggestions are sound.
5
---3-
I was surprised, but, of course, pleased to note your reference to me. And I didn't miss the wording of your dedication to your Lady — bless her and all good ladies!

I'm pushing on happily with my Old Man story. People laugh a lot and cry a bit when they hear it read aloud. We had a big birthday party (a telegram from the Governor!) and the guests asked
-4-
to hear some of the MS. We had lots of fun listening to my Florence., who does my MS work and longer letters.
You should yourself be a happy man, and I know you are. I know you practice your teaching. I've known that for years.
I am so glad you could do the book — and more so, because you actually did do it!
